label: phenotype
definition: A quality that differentiates specific instances of a species from other instances of the same species.

label: metabolism
definition: A biological process that maintain life in an organism.

label: GC content
definition: A quality that is describing the percentage of guanine and cytosine nucleotides in genomic DNA, calculated as the ratio of GC base pairs to total base pairs.

label: material entity
definition: An object or portion of a substance or mixture of substances that consists of matter

label: quality
definition: A characteristic of an entity that depends on the entity's existence, size, color, and physiological traits.

label: pH delta
parent classes (one strongly preferred): pH phenotype with numerical limits|delta phenotype with numerical limits

label: temperature delta
parent classes (one strongly preferred): temperature phenotype with numerical limits|delta phenotype with numerical limits

label: temperature optimum
parent classes (one strongly preferred): temperature phenotype with numerical limits|optimum phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A temperature phenotype with numerical limits that represents the conditions at which an organism exhibits the most efficient growth and reproduction.

label: temperature range
parent classes (one strongly preferred): temperature phenotype with numerical limits|growth range phenotype with numerical limits

label: pH optimum
parent classes (one strongly preferred): pH phenotype with numerical limits|optimum phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A pH phenotype with numerical limits that represents the conditions at which an organism exhibits the most efficient growth and reproduction.

label: pH range
parent classes (one strongly preferred): pH phenotype with numerical limits|growth range phenotype with numerical limits

label: NaCl optimum
parent classes (one strongly preferred): salinity phenotype with numerical limits|optimum phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A salinity phenotype with numerical limits that supports the most efficient growth and reproduction of an organism.

label: NaCl range
parent classes (one strongly preferred): salinity phenotype with numerical limits|growth range phenotype with numerical limits

label: NaCl delta
parent classes (one strongly preferred): salinity phenotype with numerical limits|delta phenotype with numerical limits

label: microbe
definition: A material entity that is too small to be viewed by the unaided eye, typically requiring microscopy for observation.
comment: METPO is primarily concerned with unicellular, prokaryotic life forms, i.e. bacteria and archea, including the cases of giant bacteria like Thiomargarita

label: chemical entity
definition: A material entity that is a physical entity of interest in chemistry including molecular entities, parts thereof, and chemical substances.

label: pH phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A phenotype characterized by specific pH values or ranges that define growth or activity limits.

label: salinity phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A phenotype characterized by specific salt concentration values or ranges that define growth or activity limits.

label: temperature phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A phenotype characterized by specific temperature values or ranges that define growth or activity limits.

label: delta phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A phenotype characterized by the difference between maximum and minimum values of a growth parameter.

label: growth range phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A phenotype characterized by the span of values within which an organism can maintain growth.

label: optimum phenotype with numerical limits
definition: A phenotype characterized by the value at which an organism exhibits maximum growth rate or activity.

label: oxygen preference
definition: A phenotype that is relating to an organism's oxygen requirements or tolerance for growth.

label: aerobic
definition: An oxygen preference in which growth occurs in the presence of molecular oxygen (O₂), typically using O₂ as the terminal electron acceptor.

label: anaerobic
definition: An oxygen preference in which growth occurs in the absence of molecular oxygen (O₂).

label: microaerophilic
definition: An oxygen preference that requires molecular oxygen (O₂) at concentrations lower than atmospheric.

label: facultatively anaerobic
definition: An oxygen preference in which growth can occur with or without molecular oxygen (O₂).

label: obligately aerobic
definition: An oxygen preference that requires molecular oxygen (O₂) for growth.

label: obligately anaerobic
definition: An oxygen preference in which molecular oxygen (O₂) inhibits or prevents growth.

label: facultatively aerobic
definition: An oxygen preference in which growth can occur without oxygen but is capable of aerobic growth.

label: aerotolerant
definition: An oxygen preference that does not use O₂ for growth but tolerates its presence.

label: microaerotolerant
definition: An oxygen preference that tolerates low levels of molecular oxygen (O₂) without requiring it.

label: strictly anaerobic
definition: An obligately anaerobic where a microorganism does not grow in the presence of oxygen gas (O2).

label: facultative oxygen preference
definition: An oxygen preference that describes a microorganism that can grow with or without molecular oxygen.

label: temperature preference
definition: A phenotype that describes characteristic growth with respect to environmental temperature.

label: psychrophilic
definition: A temperature preference in which growth is favored at low temperatures, typically near or below ~15 °C.

label: mesophilic
definition: A temperature preference in which growth is favored at intermediate temperatures, typically ~20–45 °C.

label: thermophilic
definition: A temperature preference in which growth is favored at elevated temperatures, typically ≥45 °C.

label: hyperthermophilic
definition: A temperature preference in which growth is favored at very high temperatures, typically ≥80 °C.

label: psychrotolerant
definition: A temperature preference in which growth can occur at low temperatures without an obligate low-temperature preference.

label: thermotolerant
definition: A temperature preference in which growth can occur at elevated temperatures without an obligate high-temperature preference.

label: halophilic
definition: A halophily preference in which an organism requires high concentrations of salt for growth and survival.

label: haloalkaliphilic
definition: A halophily preference in which an organism requires both high salt concentrations and alkaline pH for optimal growth.

label: halotolerant
definition: A halophily preference in which an organism can tolerate high salt concentrations but does not require them for growth.

label: moderately halophilic
definition: A halophily preference where growth and proliferation requires high levels of sodium chloride, usually above or about 0.2 M.

label: non halophilic
definition: A halophily preference in which an organism does not require or prefer elevated salt concentrations for growth.

label: slightly halophilic
definition: A halophily preference in which an organism requires low to moderate salt concentrations (0.3 to 0.8 M NaCl) for optimal growth.

label: stenohaline
definition: A halophily preference in which an organism can only tolerate a narrow range of salinity concentrations and cannot survive significant changes in environmental salt levels.

label: euryhaline
definition: A halophily preference in which an organism can tolerate a wide range of salinity conditions.

label: extremely halophilic
definition: A halophily preference in which an organism requires very high salt concentrations (typically 15-30% NaCl or higher) for optimal growth and cannot grow at salt concentrations below approximately 12%.

label: halophily preference
definition: A phenotype that is relating to an organism's salt concentration requirements or tolerance for growth.

label: biological process
definition: A execution of a genetically-encoded biological module or program. It consists of all the steps required to achieve the specific biological objective of the module. A biological process is accomplished by a particular set of molecular functions carried out by specific gene products (or macromolecular complexes), often in a highly regulated manner and in a particular temporal sequence.

label: trophic type
definition: A phenotype that is describing how an organism obtains carbon and energy for growth and metabolism.

label: autotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism produces organic compounds from inorganic carbon sources (primarily carbon dioxide or bicarbonate) using energy from light (photoautotrophy) or from the oxidation of inorganic compounds (chemoautotrophy).

label: carboxydotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism derives energy from the oxidation of carbon monoxide.

label: chemoautolithotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism uses chemical oxidation of inorganic compounds as the energy source and carbon dioxide as the primary carbon source for biosynthesis.

label: chemoautotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy from oxidation of inorganic compounds and carbon from carbon dioxide.

label: chemoheterotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains both energy and carbon from organic compounds.

label: chemolithoautotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy from oxidation of inorganic compounds (lithotrophy) and carbon from carbon dioxide.

label: chemolithoheterotrophic
definition: A trophic type characterized by the use of inorganic chemical compounds as electron donors for energy generation while utilizing organic compounds as the primary carbon source.

label: chemolithotrophic
definition: A trophic type characterized by the use of inorganic chemical compounds as electron donors and carbon dioxide as the primary carbon source for energy generation and biosynthesis.

label: chemoorganoheterotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains both energy and carbon from organic compounds through oxidation.

label: chemotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy from chemical oxidation of either inorganic or organic compounds.

label: copiotrophic
definition: A nutrient adaptation in which an organism thrives in environments with high nutrient concentrations, typically exhibiting rapid growth rates and utilizing diverse carbon sources.

label: heterotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains carbon from organic compounds rather than from carbon dioxide.

label: hydrogenotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism uses molecular hydrogen as an electron donor for energy generation and carbon dioxide as the primary carbon source.

label: lithoautotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy from inorganic electron donors and carbon from carbon dioxide.

label: lithoheterotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy from the oxidation of inorganic compounds while using organic compounds as the primary carbon source for biosynthesis.

label: lithotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism uses inorganic compounds as electron donors for energy generation.

label: methanotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism uses methane as the primary carbon and energy source through oxidation of methane to carbon dioxide.

label: methylotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy and carbon from reduced one-carbon compounds.

label: mixotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism can use both organic and inorganic carbon sources for growth.

label: oligotrophic
definition: A nutrient adaptation characterized by the ability to thrive in environments with very low nutrient concentrations, typically possessing efficient nutrient uptake and utilization systems.

label: organotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy from the oxidation of organic compounds.

label: photoautotrophic
definition: A trophic type characterized by the use of light as the energy source and carbon dioxide as the primary carbon source for biosynthesis.

label: photoheterotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism uses light as the energy source and organic compounds as the primary carbon source for biosynthesis.

label: photolithotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism uses light as the energy source and inorganic compounds as electron donors, typically with carbon dioxide as the primary carbon source.

label: photoorganoheterotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy from light and carbon from organic compounds.

label: phototrophic
definition: A trophic type characterized by the use of light as the primary energy source for metabolic processes, regardless of carbon source.

label: chemoorganotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy through chemical oxidation of organic compounds that also serve as the carbon source for biosynthesis.

label: organoheterotrophic
definition: A trophic type characterized by the use of organic compounds as both electron donors and primary carbon sources for energy generation and biosynthesis.

label: photolithoautotrophic
definition: A trophic type in which an organism obtains energy from light and carbon from carbon dioxide using inorganic electron donors.

label: cell shape
definition: A phenotype that describes the characteristic three-dimensional morphological form of a microbial cell, determined by cell wall structure, cytoskeletal elements, and environmental factors.

label: bacillus shaped
definition: A cell shape characterized by an elongated, rod cylindrical morphology with relatively parallel sides and rounded ends.

label: coccus shaped
definition: A cell shape in which an organism has a spherical or nearly spherical morphology, with roughly equal dimensions in all directions.

label: diplococcus shaped
definition: A cell shape in which spherical cells remain attached in pairs following cell division, forming characteristic doublets.

label: ellipsoidal
definition: A cell shape in which an organism has an oval or ellipse morphology, elongated along one axis with rounded ends, intermediate between spherical and rod-shaped.

label: ovoid shaped
definition: A cell shape in which an organism has an oval morphology, rounded at both ends with one end often slightly broader than the other.

label: oval shaped
definition: A cell shape characterized by an ellipsoidal morphology with rounded ends, resembling an elongated sphere.

label: pleomorphic shaped
definition: A cell shape characterized by variable and irregular morphology, where individual cells within a population exhibit multiple distinct shapes.

label: ring shaped
definition: A cell shape in which an organism forms circular or toroidal structures.

label: rod shaped
definition: A cell shape in which an organism has an elongated, cylindrical morphology with relatively straight sides and rounded or flat ends.

label: star shaped
definition: A cell shape in which an organism has multiple radiating projections from a central body.

label: vibrio shaped
definition: A cell shape in which an organism has a curved rod or comma morphology, characterized by a short curved cylindrical form with a single arc.

label: disc shaped
definition: A cell shape in which an organism is flat and circular.

label: fusiform shaped
definition: A cell shape that is wide in the middle and tapers at both ends.

label: spirochete shaped
definition: A cell shape in which an organism has an elongated, tightly coiled helical morphology with periplasmic flagella (endoflagella) located between the cell wall and outer membrane.

label: gram stain
definition: A phenotype where microorganisms are grouped based on their ability to retain crystal violet dye in the Gram staining procedure.

label: gram positive
definition: A gram stain in which an organism retains crystal violet dye and appears purple under microscopy due to a thick peptidoglycan cell wall.

label: gram negative
definition: A gram stain in which bacteria do not retain crystal violet dye and appear pink or red after staining, indicating a thin peptidoglycan layer and presence of an outer membrane.

label: gram variable
definition: A gram stain in which bacteria from the same culture show both gram-positive and gram-negative staining characteristics, often due to age of culture or cell wall degradation.

label: motility
definition: A phenotype in which an organism has the capability to move independently through its environment, typically by means of flagella, pili, gliding mechanisms, or other locomotory structures.

label: motile
definition: A motility in which an organism has the ability to move independently using metabolic energy.

label: non motile
definition: A motility in which an organism lacks the ability to move independently under its own power.

label: flagellated
definition: A motile in which an organism possesses flagella for locomotion.

label: axially filamented
definition: A motility where the flagellum filament of an organism is located in the periplasm and does not extend past the cell envelope.

label: gliding
definition: A motile in which an organism moves smoothly along solid surfaces without flagella or pili.

label: facultative psychrophilic
definition: A temperature preference characterized by the ability to grow at low temperatures (typically below 20Â°C) while maintaining optimal growth at moderate temperatures.

label: extreme hyperthermophilic
definition: A temperature preference that grows optimally at temperatures above 90°C.

label: nutrient adaptation
definition: A trophic type that involves an organism's physiological and metabolic adaptations to specific nutrient availability.

label: respiration
definition: A metabolism that is characterized by the method of performing cellular respiration, distinguished primarily by the specific terminal electron acceptor utilized for producing cellular energy.

label: Aerobic respiration
definition: A respiration in which molecular oxygen serves as the terminal electron acceptor in the electron transport chain, generating ATP through oxidative phosphorylation with water as the final product.

label: Anaerobic respiration
definition: A respiration in which an organism uses electron acceptors other than oxygen for energy production.

label: Oxidative phosphorylation
definition: A metabolism that generates ATP through the transfer of electrons from electron donors to electron acceptors via redox reactions, coupled to the pumping of protons across a membrane to create an electrochemical gradient.

label: Substrate-level phosphorylation
definition: A metabolism in which ATP is formed directly by transfer of a phosphoryl group from a substrate to ADP.

label: Electron transfer
definition: A metabolism in which electrons are transferred from an electron donor to an electron acceptor.

label: Disproportionation
definition: A metabolism in which a single substrate simultaneously undergoes both oxidation and reduction reactions, with part of the substrate serving as the electron donor and another part serving as the electron acceptor.

label: Methanogenesis
definition: A metabolism in which methane is produced as the primary end product through the reduction of carbon-containing compounds, formate, methanol, or acetate, exclusively performed by methanogenic archaea under strictly anaerobic conditions.

label: Acetogenesis
definition: A metabolism that produces acetate as the primary end product through the reduction of carbon dioxide or other carbon compounds using the Wood-Ljungdahl pathway, typically performed by acetogenic bacteria under anaerobic conditions.

label: Homoacetogenesis
definition: A metabolism in which acetate is produced as the sole reduced end product from reduction of CO2 via the acetyl-CoA pathway.

label: sporulation
definition: A phenotype that is relating to an organism's ability to form dormant, stress-resistant endospores.

label: spore forming
definition: A sporulation in which an organism has the ability to produce endospores.

label: non-spore forming
definition: A sporulation in which an organism lacks the ability to produce endospores.

label: cell length
definition: A phenotype that inheres in a cell by virtue of its longer dimension when viewed on a plane.

label: cell width
definition: A phenotype that inheres in a cell by virtue of its shorter dimension when viewed on a plane.

label: optimum temperature observation
definition: An observation that identifies the temperature at which a microorganism exhibits maximum growth rate or metabolic activity.

label: biosafety level
definition: A quality that categorizes biological agents according to their hazard level and required containment measures.

label: biosafety level 1
definition: A biosafety level that pose minimal potential hazard to laboratory workers and the environment, requiring only standard microbiological practices.

label: biosafety level 2
definition: A biosafety level that pose moderate risk and are associated with human diseases present in the community.

label: biosafety level 3
definition: A biosafety level that can cause serious or potentially lethal disease through inhalation or other routes, requiring specialized containment facilities with controlled access, directional airflow, and strict safety protocols.

label: biosafety level 4
definition: A biosafety level that pose extreme risk of life-threatening disease through aerosol transmission with no available treatment.

label: biosafety level 5
definition: A biosafety level that is proposed as a classification beyond BSL-4 for hypothetical biological agents requiring enhanced containment.

label: Cable bacteria metabolism
definition: A metabolism in which electrons are transferred over centimeter-scale distances through multicellular filaments.

label: Fermentation
definition: A respiration that generates energy through the oxidation of organic compounds without using an external electron acceptor, using organic molecules as both electron donors and final electron acceptors.

label: Syntrophy
definition: A metabolism in which the metabolism of one species is thermodynamically dependent on the removal of its products by another species.

label: pH growth preference
definition: A phenotype that describes how the rate and extent of population growth are affected by environmental pH.

label: neutrophilic
definition: A pH growth preference characterized by optimal growth at near-neutral pH values, typically between pH 6.5 and 7.5.

label: alkaphilic
definition: A pH growth preference in which an organism grows optimally at pH values above 9.

label: acidophilic
definition: A pH growth preference in which an organism grows optimally at pH values below 5.

label: obligately alkaphilic
definition: A pH growth preference in which an organism requires alkaline conditions (typically pH above 8.5) for growth and cannot grow at neutral or acidic pH.

label: facultatively alkaphilic
definition: A pH growth preference in which an organism can grow at alkaline pH but does not require it.

label: obligately acidophilic
definition: A pH growth preference characterized by the requirement for acidic environments (pH below 5.5) for growth, with inability to grow at neutral or alkaline pH values.

label: facultatively acidophilic
definition: A pH growth preference characterized by optimal growth in acidic environments (pH below 5.5) with the capacity to also grow at near-neutral pH values.

label: acidotolerant
definition: A pH growth preference characterized by the ability to tolerate acidic environments (typically pH below 5.5) while maintaining optimal growth near neutral pH.

label: alkalotolerant
definition: A pH growth preference in which an organism can tolerate alkaline pH but grows optimally at neutral pH.

label: pigmentation
definition: A phenotype characterized by the color of pigments produced by a microorganism.

label: pathogenic to host
definition: A phenotype where a microbe is a pathogen of of some host organism.

label: animal pathogen
definition: A pathogen that infects organisms in the kingdom Metazoa.

label: plant pathogen
definition: A pathogen that infects organisms in the kingdom Viridiplantae.

label: human pathogen
definition: A pathogen that infects organisms of the species Homo sapiens.

label: growth medium
definition: A processed material that provides the nutrients and environmental conditions necessary for the cultivation of microorganisms in vitro. Growth media may be liquid (broth) or solid (agar-based) and are formulated to support the growth of specific types of organisms.
comment: This class is equivalent to OBI:0000079 'culture medium'. It is included in METPO to serve as the range for growth-related object properties.
